subject: Writing
event:
These worldbook "sidebars" are all threatening to turn into novellas.

Sure hope you guys and gals like fake history.

props.taglist: song of ice and fire, writing

comments.article: Sounds extremely promising Ser Martin!!! Might I venture to guess, dear ser, you are feeling motivated and creatively inspired from all your adventures and travels? Hazzah!!
comments.subject: "threatening"  lol

comments.article: Cryptic much, Unca George?
comments.subject: Cryptic...

comments.article: Yes.
I hope so; I've been looking forward to that. I love history, even fake history.
comments.subject: Is this for the book you're doing with Elio and Linda?

comments.article: LOVE fake history :P
The history of the world you've created is part of the reason I'm so looking forward to this.
The Faker the better.

Similarly, the appendices at the end of Lord of the Rings are what got me into world building in AD&D, which in turn got me into spreadsheets and HTML and other marketable skills when computers became available.

(I think there probably have been more RPG worlds made than there have been actual (tabletop) RPG players.)

However, what got me interested in current events was Tom Lehrer and MAD Magazine.
comments.subject: Fake history's what got me interested in real history.

comments.article: Tom Lehrer for the win!
comments.subject: Re: Fake history's what got me interested in real history.

comments.article: Seriously?  That would be awesome!

comments.upictitle: jennifer, countess of grantham.: GoT: JS; Brothers. [nyaza]
comments.article:
This is the BEST NEWS. YES PLEASE.

I majored in Medieval History in Uni, but by Jove, I think I'm starting to know more about Westeros! (AND I LOVE IT.)
Oh, I like them LOTS. ♥

comments.upictitle: a sudden absence of bees: books!
comments.article: This post makes me happy.

Oh dear, it appears I'm going to be throwing myself into the realm of fantasy once more. (I'm not really complaining, I think if it could be so, I'd live in Westeros myself).

I hope that my novel can engage so many avid readers one day.
Look forward to more posts and books Mr. George,
Matt Peacock.
I wouldn't mind living in Westros, but they need to improve the indoor plumbing before I move. That and the general attitude towards women.
Can't wait. I am doing the same in my first novel. So much thought goes into creating a starting point. Thank you for being such an outstanding inspiration.
comments.subject: re;

comments.article: All the fake genealogy got me into my real genealogy...  and fake history is even MORE fun (particularly when it includes dragons!).

I would pay to spectate you writing.
With a "W" painted on my chest and four other dudes drinking beer in your office with R-I-T-E drawn on them respectively.
comments.subject: Pound That Keyboard!

comments.upictitle: a very caring potato: puss in boots
comments.article: Oh, I do. When it's good, which I know yours will be. *rubs hands in gleeful anticipatin*

wow, sounds awesome!
I know the maps one is supposed to be out In Oct...what's the target for this one?
Would we be reading otherwise?

comments.upictitle: [not pictured]: confused pirate-y objection Guybrush surprised
comments.article: Basically what I came here to say.  "A Song of Ice and Fire" is so the wrong series for people who don't like fake history.  (It's a good thing I adore quality world-building.)
FAKE?!  But I...I've been saving all my money for a trip to Westeros someday...
comments.subject: Fake...?

comments.article: Pretty sure we love everything you do.

Fake history? That's a whole side genre by itself isn't it?
Usually Harry Turtledove?
Coune me in.  I love fake history! Novella away, ser. Huzzah!
